intro: Croton hirsutus, commonly known as the woolly croton, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its thick, hairy stems and leaves that are typically green with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in some regions.
